entry.title: Combined summary - Breach of contract?
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around Hash Time-Locked Contracts (HTLCs) in the Lightning Network. The main concern raised is that HTLC-TIMEOUT requires constant monitoring of the blockchain for a low interval to avoid losing money. Using HTLCs doubles the timelock on LN payments, increasing fees and possibly biasing towards less graph centralization. In an email conversation, Christopher Jamthagen expresses concern over the design of HTLCs and how they can be invalidated. Joseph Poon responds by explaining that the design of HTLCs has a contestation period built-in where the party broadcasting the Commitment Transaction must wait before the payment goes back to themselves. Rusty Russell suggests a solution that involves having some funds in reserve available on one's own channel balance to ensure honesty and proposes that the total value of the HTLCs must be below one's own reserve balance for both parties.
